en.title: Hourly FWI (NG–CFFDRS)
en.running_hfwi_modal: Running HFWI… This can take a moment on first run.
en.mapping_help: Map your columns to what NG–CFFDRS expects. Provide either a single Date–Time column, or Year/Month/Day/Hour.
en.tt_col_datetime: Single local Date‑Time or ISO‑8601 with 'Z' or UTC offset. If an explicit zone/offset is present it will be respected.
en.tt_col_id: A station or unique ID for the weather station(s). Gets converted to text.
en.tt_col_year: Year (e.g., 2025). Use if no single Date‑Time column.
en.tt_col_month: Month (1–12). Use if no single Date‑Time column.
en.tt_col_day: Day (1–31). Use if no single Date‑Time column.
en.tt_col_hour: Hour of day in local time (0–23). Use if no single Date‑Time column.
en.tt_manual_lat: Latitude in decimal degrees (negative for south).
en.tt_manual_lon: Longitude in decimal degrees (negative for west).
en.tt_col_date: Optional. Select the column containing calendar dates (e.g., 2024-05-01 or 05/01/2024). Leave blank if you provide Date–Time or Year/Month/Day/Hour.
en.tt_col_time: Optional. Select the column containing times (e.g., 13:00, 1:00 PM, or 13.5 for 13:30). Leave blank if you provide Date–Time or Year/Month/Day/Hour.
en.tt_col_solrad: Optional. Solar shortwave radiation (e.g., W/m² or MJ/m²/h). If mapped, it will be passed through to the hFWI input table.
en.tt_time_zone: Auto: infer one IANA time zone from lat/lon (or browser as fallback). Fixed: choose a single IANA time zone.
en.tt_tz_offset_policy: Standard: ignore DST for solar calculations. Modal: use the most common offset in your data (may include DST).
en.drop_rows_help: If set, rows with local date < this value are removed before hFWI().
en.tt_start_date: Drop rows before this local date (faster runs/plots).
en.tt_calc_fwi87: Also compute daily FWI (1987) from hourly inputs (slower).
en.tt_download: Download the hFWI results as CSV.
en.tt_plot_dataset: Choose to visualize hFWI results or the input weather data.
en.tt_plot_vars: Choose one or more variables to visualize. Defaults depend on the selected dataset: Inputs show temperature, RH, wind speed, and rain; Results show FFMC, DMC, DC, and FWI.
en.tt_plot_y_multi: Select one or more numeric variables to facet along the y‑axis.
en.tt_plot_facets_ncol: Number of small multiples per row.
en.tt_plot_free_y: Allow each facet to have its own y‑scale.
en.tt_plot_smoothing: Add a smoother to the time series (LOESS for local patterns, GAM for global).
en.tt_plot_points: Toggle points on the time series.
en.tt_plot_lines: Toggle lines on the time series.
en.tt_plot_ci: Toggle the confidence band for the smoother when applicable.
en.tt_plot_color_by: Colour series by station, dataset, or leave ungrouped.
en.modal_title: How to use the FWI25 app
en.csv_spec_html:
Expected CSV structure

  • Required columns: Temperature (°C), RH (%), Wind (km/h), Rain (mm).
  • Date/Time: either one Date‑Time column (local or ISO‑8601 with Z/UTC offset), or four columns: Year, Month, Day, Hour (0–23).
  • Optional: Latitude & Longitude (degrees) for time‑zone inference if TZ mode = Auto;
  • Column headers can be reselected via the Column mapping panel below; missing values allowed ('', NA, NaN, null).
en.csv_spec_sr: Expected CSV: Required columns are Temperature in degrees Celsius, Relative Humidity in percent, Wind in kilometers per hour, and Rain in millimeters. Provide either a single Date-Time column, or Year/Month/Day/Hour (0 to 23). Latitude and Longitude are optional but helpful for automatic time-zone inference.
en.pop_time_zone_html:
Time zone mode

  • Auto: infer one IANA time zone from latitude/longitude (or use browser as fallback).
  • Fixed: choose a single IANA time zone for all rows.

The zone affects local dates and solar calculations (e.g., sunrise).
en.pop_tz_offset_html:
Offset policy for solar calcs

  • Standard: ignore DST; use the standard offset year‑round.
  • Modal: use the most common offset present in your data (may include DST).

fr.csv_spec_html:
Structure CSV attendue

  • Colonnes obligatoires : Température (°C), HR (%), Vent (km/h), Pluie (mm).
  • Date/Heure : une Date‑heure (locale ou ISO‑8601 avec Z/décalage UTC) ou Année/Mois/Jour/Heure (0–23).
  • Optionnel : Latitude & Longitude (degrés) pour le fuseau en mode Auto;
  • Les en‑têtes se règlent dans Correspondance des colonnes; valeurs manquantes permises ('', NA, NaN, null).
fr.csv_spec_sr: CSV attendu : Température en °C, Humidité relative en %, Vent en km/h, Pluie en mm. Fournir une colonne Date‑heure unique, ou Année/Mois/Jour/Heure (0 à 23). Latitude et Longitude optionnelles (fuseau automatique).
fr.pop_time_zone_html:
Mode de fuseau horaire

  • Auto : déduire un fuseau IANA à partir de la latitude/longitude (ou navigateur).
  • Fixe : choisir un seul fuseau IANA pour toutes les lignes.

Le fuseau influe sur les dates locales et les calculs solaires (p. ex., lever du soleil).
fr.pop_tz_offset_html:
Politique de décalage pour les calculs solaires

  • Standard : ignorer l’heure d’été; utiliser le décalage standard toute l’année.
  • Modal : utiliser le décalage le plus fréquent dans vos données (peut inclure l’heure d’été).
